The walls, the camera, eventually even Spassky DISAPPEARS Until it is only Bobby and the chessboard -- which begins GLOW as the lines of infinite possibility present themsel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby makes his move and SLAPS his clock. Boris examines Bobby's move with more than a little confusion. He looks and sees no expression on Bobby's face. Bobby is in the zone. He has reached some kind of absence in which there are only moves -- and Spassky knows it. Caption: Game Six. Boris studies the board again, then quickly looks back up Bobby with disbelief, then back to the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ABC commentator is listening to the feed on his headse

dialogues.speaker: ABC COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Don't use jargon... In plain English just tell me what he's doing? The people here say he's playing like a wild man. Could you ask our chess guy exactly what Fischer is doing? The anchor reacts to a lost signal. He looks to his produ

dialogues.speaker: ABC COMMENTATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lost the feed.... I need someone to tell me what the fuck is happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lombardy is watching as if in the midst of a religious experience.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: ...What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOMBARDY
dialogues.text: There are no names for it. Yet. The Soviets are equally speechless. 217 218  219 220 221 222 223 224 225 Yellow Revision 10-11-13 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spassky finally summons up the will to make another move. Without any hesitation, Bobby POUNCES -- like a panther. A collective GASP from the audience. Spassky stares at the move. His world is falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine and the others watch in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: LOMBARDY
dialogues.text: ..-It is beyond my ability to explain or understand. Across the gallery we catch Livo Nei's awestruck expressi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute silence. Bobby is going for the kill, crushing the fly. Serene. He makes his move. Boris blinks once. He looks up at Bobby. Bobby's eyes are still, his mind empty. A flicker of incomprehension cross Boris's face. Then he half smiles as he realizes he is be He KNOCKS over his King with a flick of his finger. It falls in SLOW-MOTION -- like a building being demolish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall applauds wildly. Nei gets to his feet too and applauds. Geller glares at h Lombardy applauds, filled with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and her kids are jumping up and down, clapping.  226 227 228 229 230 231 232 Green Revision 10-14-13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regina fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chess players are going wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars HONK, pedestrians CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then...Boris gets to his feet and begins to applaud. Bobby is at first confused, then astonished.

For one last, delicious second, Bobby is in the safe, qui zone. Then a WAVE of SOUND hits as THE AUDIENCE APPLAUDS. Bobby CRINGES, then slumps in his chair like a puppet wit its strings cut. The crowd applauds even more as they see Boris acknowledging the beauty of the game Bobby just pla

dialogues.speaker: ABC COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Bobby Fischer has just won game six and his opponent Boris Spassky is actually on his feet, appl auding. People applaud wildly; the anchor has to raise his voice.

dialogues.speaker: ABC COMMENTATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grandmasters never, ever applaud an opponent's victory. But I guess this is something-- (re at cheering crowd) --no one has ever seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd ERUPTS as Bobby emerges and heads down the stai A mass of humanity SURGES forward -- crowding him, touchi him -- everybody wants a piece of him. We SENSE Bobby's panic. The SCREAMS, the FLASHBULBS, the faces, the hands reaching for him. It's all too much. 226 227 228 229 230 231 232  233 234 235 236 113. Then a face in the crowd -- it's Regina! -- But it can't be. She's in Moscow. Bobby looks again but she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Mom! He frantically looks around. Then another face -- Joan! O course she, too, couldn't possibly be there.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joanie! And then....is that Uncle Paul? No, that's impossible. Marshall and a couple of his guys usher him into a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sits in the back as the limo moves slowly through t crowd. Fans POUND on the glass but he looks straight ahea Over this a caption: Bobby Fischer went on to beat Boris Spassky 12 1/2 - 8 1/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Limo makes it way through the cheering crowd. Suddenly, amidst the crowd, Bobby catches a glimpse of TH TELEPHOTO MAN -- who has spied on him since he was a chil He leans back out of sight. He never tried to defend his title and no other American ever become world champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheering is replaced by the sound of a howling wind. Bobby walks alone in the snow-blasted park. He stops at o of the chess tables and wipes away snow with his sleeve. His descent into insanity was swift and permanent. He stares at the empty squares.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- It's a worldwide Jewish conspiracy-- Mossad, the defense industry and the media. Secret government projects using micowaves to monitor our brains.  237 238 239 240 Green Revision 10-14-13 114. Alienating the world with his bizarre behavior, his US passport was revoked and he lived in exile, eventually becoming homeless.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 9-11, man. Wonderful news. Time for the fucking U.S. to get their heads kicked in. Shows you that what goes around, comes around...

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK
dialogues.text: Bobby stands up from the table and slowly walks off into blizzard...until he disappears...and all that we see A WHITE SCREEN that RESOLVES INTO:

dialogues.speaker: SLOW-MOTION MOCK-ARCHIVAL FOOTAGE, (HIGH SCHOOL GYM)
dialogues.text: is: Bobby at the height of his power, playing 20 boards at a time, his movements graceful, passionate, full of life. Bobby Fischer died in 2008 and was buried in Reykjavik, Iceland, the site of his remarkable triumph.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEW SOUNDBITE
dialogues.text: A smiling Bobby sits on a bench in Washington Square.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Chess and me, we're pretty intertwined. I don't really have much else in my life right now. Maybe someday I'1l spread out a little. For now, though, I'd like to be world champion-- (a slow smile) --And then keep it for, say, twenty years. Yeah. CLOSE on Bobby as a big grin spreads across his face. FADE OUT. 237 238 239 240
